revised_title: Observations on Air in Pleura and Experiments on Air Absorption
tldr: The author investigates the presence of air in the pleura of a patient with pneumato-thorax and conducts experiments to understand the absorption of different types of air introduced into the pleura. The study reveals that the oxygen in the air is absorbed in a greater proportion than nitrogen, and carbon dioxide is formed or emitted in the air cells of the lungs.
